paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Individuals from Portugal, Japan, and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mutant Val30Met has high penetrance, early age of onset (twenties to early forties), and rapid progression of polyneuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation leads to increased amyloidogenic potential.

variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most prevalent and well-studied variant in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The Val30Met mutation has high penetrance, early age of onset (twenties to early forties), and rapid progression of polyneuropathy.
Individuals carrying the Ser52Pro mutation develop aggressive and early-onset fatal ATTR.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with a higher frequency of congestive heart failure.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is linked to heart failure and lower mortality.

variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is prevalent among African Americans.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with a higher frequency of congestive heart failure and a trend towards lower mortality.

individual_records.phenotype_details: developed aggressive and early-onset fatal ATTR
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Individuals carrying the Ser52Pro mutation develop aggressive and early-onset fatal ATTR.

functional_data.summary: The Ser52Pro mutation leads to rapid disease progression.

variants.additional_notes: The Ser52Pro mutation is associated with a severe phenotype.
key_quotes: Individuals carrying the Ser52Pro mutation develop aggressive and early-onset fatal ATTR.

tables_processed.table_caption: Nomenclature and key features of common types of amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
